full_text:
Reminds me of the "Radio Luxembourg effect" back in the 30's. Radio 
Luxembourg's shortwave transmitters were running tremendously high power 
and were being heard superimposed over a Swiss radio station's broadcasts, 
even though they were nowhere near the same frequency.

We studied this when I was studying plasma physics in college.

Here's a bit of info:

http://ion.le.ac.uk/heating/history_of_rf_heating.html

Zack
